page.title: 07SHOPPING - BARGOED AREA
page.content: Bargoed functions as a local district shopping centre with a catchment area of smaller surrounding communities. It is an important centre for convenience shopping, with a decline over the last 10 to 20 years in the sale of durable goods. There have been few physical changes in Bargoed's main shopping streets since their growth at the turn of the century. With few exceptions the units are small. There are 150 units. Only 11% are run by national multiple companies e.g. Woolworths, a further 11% are regional multiples, leaving the vast majority as small family businesses. This is probably due to the inadequate size of available premises and the physical constraint of the town centre. Service outlets e.g. building societies have, to a fairly large extent, replaced rather than added to existing units.
